00081 class IdxSpec {
00082 
00083  private:
00084 
00089   int setndim(int n);
00090 
00093   int setndim(int n, intg *ldim, intg *lmod);
00094 
00096   int ndim;
00098   intg offset;
00100   intg *dim;
00102   intg *mod;
00103 
00111   intg resize(intg s0=-1, intg s1=-1, intg s2=-1, intg s3=-1,
00112               intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);
00113 
00114   template<typename SizeIter> intg resize( SizeIter& dimsBegin, SizeIter& dimsEnd ){
00115 
00116         const int nArgDims = std::distance(dimsBegin, dimsEnd);
00117 
00118         // Error-check the supplied number of dims.
00119         if( ndim == 0 ){
00120                 ylerror("Cannot call resize on a 0-dimensional IdxSpec.");
00121         }
00122         else if( ndim != nArgDims ){
00123                 std::ostringstream oss;
00124                 oss<<"Number of supplied dimension sizes ("<<nArgDims<<") doesn't match IdxSpec's number of dims ("<<ndim<<")";
00125                 ylerror(oss.str().c_str());
00126         }
00127 
00128         // copy dimensions to dim
00129         std::copy(dimsBegin, dimsEnd, dim);
00130 
00131         // set mod to be the partial sum of the dim sequence, in reverse order.
00132         typedef std::reverse_iterator<SizeIter> RIter;
00133         typedef std::reverse_iterator<intg*> RintgIter;
00134         std::partial_sum( RIter(dimsEnd-1),
00135                                           RIter(dimsBegin-1),
00136                                           RintgIter(mod+(nArgDims-1)),
00137                                           std::multiplies<intg>() );
00138 
00139         // return the memory footprint
00140         return mod[0] * dim[0] + offset;
00141   }
00142 
00144   intg setoffset(intg o) { return offset = o; }
00145 
00146  public:
00147 
00149   ~IdxSpec();
00150 
00152   const IdxSpec& operator=( const IdxSpec& src);
00153 
00155   void copy( const IdxSpec& src);
00156 
00158   IdxSpec( const IdxSpec& src);
00159 
00162   IdxSpec();
00163 
00165   IdxSpec(intg o);
00166 
00168   IdxSpec(intg o, intg size0);
00169 
00171   IdxSpec(intg o, intg size0, intg size1);
00172 
00174   IdxSpec(intg o, intg size0, intg size1, intg size2);
00175 
00177   IdxSpec(intg o, intg s0, intg s1, intg s2, intg s3,
00178           intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);
00179 
00182   IdxSpec(intg o, int n, intg *ldim, intg *lmod);
00183 
00185   intg getoffset() { return offset; }
00186 
00188   int getndim() { return ndim; }
00189 
00193   intg footprint()  {
00194     intg r = offset + 1;
00195     for(int i=0; i<ndim; i++){ r += mod[i]*(dim[i]-1); }
00196     return r;
00197   }
00198 
00200   intg nelements() {
00201     intg r = 1;
00202     for(int i=0; i<ndim; i++){ r *= dim[i]; }
00203     return r;
00204   }
00205 
00209   bool contiguousp() {
00210     intg size = 1; bool r = true;
00211     for(int i=ndim-1; i>=0; i--){
00212       if (size != mod[i]) r = false;
00213       size *= dim[i];
00214     }
00215     return r;
00216   }
00217

00389   // TODO: Find out why code such as Idx<float> = 1 compiles
00390   // (even without default operator below).
00391   // default operator below outputs an error that this is forbidden.
00392   virtual Idx<T>& operator=(T other){
00393         ylerror("Forbidden Idx assignment. Idx can only be assigned another Idx.");
00394         return *this;
00395   }
00396 
00397   virtual Idx<T>& operator=(const Idx<T>& other) {
00398         Srg<T> *tmp = NULL;
00399         if (this->storage != NULL)
00400                 tmp = this->storage;
00401           this->storage = other.storage;
00402           this->spec = other.spec;
00403           this->storage->lock();
00404           if (tmp)
00405                 tmp->unlock();
00406           return *this;
00407   }
00408 
00409   virtual Idx<T> operator[](const intg i) {
00410           return this->select(0,i);
00411   }
00412 
00414   // Keep this 'explicit' until we decide to implement operator=.
00415   //Idx( Idx<T>& other );
00416   //Idx( const Idx<T>& other );

00439           storage->lock();
00440   }

00478   virtual void resize_chunk(intg s_chunk, intg s0=-1, intg s1=-1, intg s2=-1, intg s3=-1,
00479               intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);
00486   template<typename SizeIter>
00487   void resize( SizeIter& sizesBegin, SizeIter& sizesEnd ){
00488                 const int ndims = std::distance( sizesBegin, sizesEnd );
00489                 if ( ndims > MAXDIMS ){
00490                         std::ostringstream oss;
00491                         oss<<"Number of dimensions ("<<ndims<<") exceeds MAX_DIMS ("<<MAXDIMS<<")";
00492                         ylerror(oss.str().c_str());
00493                 }
00494 
00495                 std::vector<T> sizes(ndims+1);
00496                 std::copy(sizesBegin, sizesEnd, sizes.begin());
00497                 sizes.back() = -1;
00498                 spec.resize( sizesBegin, sizesEnd );
00499                 growstorage();
00500   }

00655

00657   intg i;  // loop index
00658   intg dimd;  // number of elements to iterated upon
00659   intg modd; // stride in dimension being iterated upon

00670

00672 };

00677 // Idx Iterators: gives you a pointer to the actual data,
00678 // unlike IdxLooper which gives you another Idx.
00679 
00694 template <class T> class IdxIter {
00695 
00696  public:
00698   T *data;
00700   intg i;
00702   intg n;
00704   int j;
00706   intg d[MAXDIMS];
00708   Idx<T> *iterand;
00709 
00711   IdxIter();
00712 
00715   T *init(Idx<T> &idx);
00716 
00718   bool notdone();
00719 
00721   T *next();
00722 
00724   T& operator*() { return *data; }
00725 
00726 };
